title: BBC Local Live: Channel Islands on Friday 5 January 2018 - BBC News
summary: police 'a little embarrassed ' by facebook gaffe .
'fewer than 10 beds free ' at jersey 's hospital .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: our coverage across the channel islands has finished for today .
we 'll be back on monday from 07:00 with the latest news , weather , travel and sport .
do n't forget bbc channel islands news on bbc one at 22:30 and to get the latest news for your area from the bbc .

documents.title: weather : further showers overnight
text: there will be further showers overnight , perhaps with some hail and thunder in places .
it will be occasionally breezy and colder than of late with perhaps a grass frost in some rural spots , or icy patches where showers have been .
minimum temperature : 6c ( 43f ) .
it will remain rather cloudy through saturday with further heavy downpours at times , with a continue risk of thunder .
it will be cold with an added wind chill from a brisk easterly wind .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
sunday is likely to be colder and drier with frost by night and some sunshine by day .
on monday it will turn cloudier and windier , with rain possible later on tuesday .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: perelle and l'eree coast roads to reopen tomorrow
text: perelle and l'eree coast roads to reopen tomorrow

documents.title: battered alderney breakwater work may start 'next week '
text: work to repair a damaged section of alderney 's breakwater can only take place once the weather and the sea conditions improve , possibly by next week , the states of guernsey says .
storm eleanor dislodged sections of masonry on the top of the upper wall both on the outside and inside of the victorian structure .

`` nothing can be done in the immediate short-term other than observe , but full on-site inspections will be completed as soon as it is safe to venture on to the breakwater , once the weather and the sea conditions improved , '' guernsey states said .

the battering that the breakwater receives is truly staggering and it is impressive how this remarkable 900m structure , which gives protection to alderney 's commercial harbour and braye bay , continues to stand up to the elements more than 150 years after its construction to create an anchorage for the british fleet . ''
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: ci weather : your
text: thanks to our weather watchers for sending these contrasting in from across the islands today .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: condor : disruption 'beyond our control '
text: condor says it 's determined to minimise further disrupution to passengers this weekend , as weather and industrial action in france disrupt sailings .

`` we are dismayed that these factors , which are beyond our control , are once again , disrupting passengers and freight customers ' shipments and we understand they will naturally be very disappointed .
`` condor ferries is determined to minimise the effect these challenges have on passengers ' travel plans and our freight customers ' cargo shipments , '' ceo paul luxon said .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: police legs gaffe : gulliver tweets
text: to err is human , and even the states of jersey police twitter account can be human .
i must admit the odd giggle at their quick witted humour .
remember not to twitter in bed !
@ jerseypolice
author: Twitter

documents.title: keeper stanton rejoins guernsey fc
text: keeper stanton rejoins guernsey fc

documents.title: orange weather warning continues
text: a gale wind warning remains in place across the islands , with strong gusts persisting .
you 're being asked to remain vigilant and check the latest forecast in the force seven southwest-to-westerly winds .
wind warning № 19/1 , issued at 14:54 utc , 05/01/2018 .
author: Twitter

documents.title: alternative ferry terminal restaurant plans
text: ports of jersey will announce their short-term plans for the restaurant at elizabeth terminal next week .
it 's seeking a new tenant after plans for the ferry site 's cafe were scrapped .
ports of jersey had been planning to open a new smokehouse and craft beer restaurant called terminal gbj at the ferry terminal .
the department says delays and over-ambition put a halt to the project .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: condor 's amended weekend schedule
text: a combination of weather and industrial action in france has resulted in changes to sailings .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: strike , weather , disrupt st malo sailings
text: saturday 's condor liberation sailings to st malo have been cancelled due to strike action by dockers in france .
the company has amended tomorrow 's schedule , with services still running from poole to the islands .
sunday 's condor service between jersey and st malo is also cancelled due to the poor weather forecast .
info | high speed services for saturday 6th and sunday 7th january 2018 have been disrupted .
further information can be found at
hi what is happening with stevedore action ?
is sat 09.05 def going ahead ?
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: harbour restaurant plans scrapped
text: the manager of a new restaurant planned at jersey 's elizabeth terminal says he 's gutted the scheme has been scrapped after more than four years of planning .
the decision was announced on the terminal gbj facebook page , the name given to the space where the restaurant was planned .
they have been dropped following a breakdown in the relationship between the ports of jersey and the restaurant operators .

`` at the last moment , it was unfortunate that ports of jersey and ourselves could not reach a legal agreement that mirrored the agreement originally signed four years ago , and that either party was satisfied to be able to move forward with , '' the page said .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: storm-battered west coast road reopens
text: albecq coast road - castel - open the above road is now open to traffic as normal .
author: Twitter

documents.title: uk head teacher backs alternative 11-18 model
text: the head teacher of an award-winning uk comprehensive will visit the island next week to outline his support for the alternative 11-18 education model .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: alderney breakwater damaged by storm eleanor
text: severe storms over the past days have taken their toll on alderney 's breakwater .
sections of masonry on the top of the upper wall both on the outside and the inside have been dislodged , states of guernsey 's agriculture , countryside and land management services said .
`` the damage appears to be restricted to the first ( landward ) third of the breakwater which has been the site of damage and breaches in the past , '' it said .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: hamon joins gloucester city on loan
text: exeter city 's guernsey-born goalkeeper james hamon has joined national league south side gloucester city on a 93-day loan .
the 22-year-old , who has played nearly 30 games for the grecians , has made just three starts for exeter this season in the checkatrade trophy .
having trained with gloucester on thursday he will go straight into their squad for their match with weston-super-mare on saturday .
his departure comes after exeter brought in paul jones on loan from norwich city on thursday .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: police 'a little embarrassed ' by facebook gaffe
text: states of jersey police say the force is `` a little embarrassed '' after a photo of a staff member 's leg was posted on facebook in error .
the photograph accompanied a message asking members of the public to be careful cycling as storm eleanor hit the island .
police said the photo was `` accidentally uploaded '' .
whilst there was nothing offensive about the as you can imagine we are a little embarrassed by our mistake , as is the person involved .
that said , it shows that our staff are working at all hours trying to keep the public informed , even from the comfort of our homes .
we are only human after all ! ''
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: hospital on red alert as bed capacity exceeds 91 %
text: a red alert was issued at the princess elizabeth hospital yesterday as bed occupancy exceeded 91 % .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: deputies 'do engage ' with youth
text: a politician is highlighting efforts to engage young people in politics after a law student from guernsey was critical of efforts to engage with islanders .
joe broughton , 24 , said deputies should work harder to ignite interest in politics .
deputy sarah hansmann-rouxel , elected for the first time in april 2016 , said work - including school visits and arranging parliament viewings - were already ongoing .
@ twitterid great to hear from local youth wanting young people to be more informed about politics .
there is already @ twitterid free info and education packs .
deputies also visit school and schools can organise visit to the states assembly .
author: Phillippa Guillou
BBC Radio Guernsey reporter

documents.title: avoid collapsed pier at grève de lecq , islanders warned
text: islanders are being warned to stay away from grève de lecq pier after stormy weather caused a section of it to collapse .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: pumping out at perelle
text: stormy conditions continued to wreak havoc on guernsey 's west coast yesterday morning .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: national trust offer 'binocular amnesty ' after holiday theft
text: an unusual online appeal has been launched for the return of birdwatching equipment which has gone missing from a hide in st ouen 's bay .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: landlines restored and working - jt
text: all of jt 's jersey landlines are restored and working , according to the telecoms company .
yesterday , 34,000 phone customers lost landline services as a result of storm eleanor .
jt said engineers continued to be vigilant and were monitoring services carefully .
`` we will keep customers updated and ask them to monitor our social channels and website for further updates .
`` all other mobile and broadband services continue to be working as normal , '' the company said .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: church toilet plans spark opposition
text: a church rector has been forced by heritage campaigners to host a parish meeting after concerns plans to build a toilet would spoil a jersey church .
campaigners have got the necessary 10 parishioner signatures to call an ecclesiastical assembly within two weeks .
the plans for the toilet at st lawrence church , which would be attached to an entrance to the building , were originally refused but then later approved on appeal .
supporters say it would allow older people and children to use the church more freely .
the signatures were presented to rector phil warren yesterday .
the toilet work will cost £ 8,000 , if approved .
author: Elisa DaSilva
BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: extra water needed to extinguish boiler room
text: extra water had to be taken to a fire at an outbuilding in trinity last night because local supplies were n't enough .
shortly after attending at 21:00 the fire department had to send an extra water carrier to the scene because it could n't get enough from regular supplies there .
eleven firemen were involved in putting the fire out , remaining on site for about two hours .
staff believe the fire was started by an electrical appliance .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: breakingwest coast flooded again
text: fire crews are at vazon again on guernsey 's west coast this morning after water crashed over sea walls during the high tide .
flooding was not as severe as the previous two days , but crews are still assisting at vistas cafe , which has been damaged by storm eleanor .
teams are also working to clear debris on coastal roads , guernsey 's joint emergency services control centre said .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: artist taking up residence on royal navy ice patrol ship
text: a jersey painter and sculptor is going to have to wrap up warm when he embarks on the trip of a lifetime as `` artist in residence '' on-board a royal navy ice patrol ship .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: deputies offer 'credible ' alternative schools plan
text: the local representative of a national teaching union has backed alternative plans for the future of secondary education in guernsey .
sean mcmanus from the national education union says the two-school model has been put forward by a group of `` serious-minded '' deputies who have listened to local teachers .
he said the original plans for three schools , put forward by the government 's education , sport and culture committee ( esc ) , were not widely supported by industry professionals .
in promoting the three-school option , its president paul le pelley said they were doing the right thing for island youngsters .
`` sadly , the contents of the esc document fail to command the confidence of significant sectors of the local education community . ''
instead , mr mcmanus said there was support for the alternative proposals - to be debated later this month .
`` they 've framed a series of what seemed to us a series of credible alternatives which may embrace mainly the suggestions afforded to them by the professionals , '' he said .
author: Phillippa Guillou
BBC Radio Guernsey reporter

documents.title: new hospital report delay
text: a report into the building proposals for the new hospital has been delayed but is expected to be completed by monday , environment minister steve luce has said .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: high tide in guernsey
text: this morning 's flood warning is currently in place on guernsey 's west coast , as the 32ft ( 9.8m ) 08:44 high tide combines with strong west-to-southwesterly winds .
further flooding is expected and you 're being advised to take extreme caution .
author: Oscar Pearson
BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: west coast tide warning tonight
text: a 30ft ( 9.3m ) high tide and strong winds expected later means a tide warning - the third most severe - has been issued for tonight .
people heading to guernsey 's west coast need to be aware of waves breaking over sea walls and debris on coastal roads and paths .
a tide warning has been issued for guernsey 's west coast tonight at 21:12 gmt ( 05/01/18 ) .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: empty supermarket shelves 'unprecedented '
text: the channel islands co-op says delays in food deliveries because of storm eleanor this week were unprecedented .
guernsey and jersey faced serious shortages of fresh food as strong winds and high tides have affected freight ferries trying to get to the islands , but the situation is now improving .
co-op chief operating officer mark cox said : `` certainly in my period of time i ca n't remember us experiencing such delays , or a cancellation of a ferry for that long .
`` it is an improving situation , but there was a period there of over 48 hours where we were very short of products as all island supermarkets were . ''
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: beware of the puddle
text: all road users & pedestrians be aware of significant surface water across grandes capelles lane / junction of les effards road .
anyone entering the lane from les effards please be extremely cautious as the flooding can not be seen in advance of turning into grandes capelles lane
author: Twitter

documents.title: guernsey beach rubbish highlights 'significant problem '
text: a guernsey environmentalist says the increased amount of rubbish washed up on guernsey 's beaches as a result of storm eleanor has underscored the problem of rubbish being dumped in the world 's oceans .
regular beachcomber janet unitt says she 's found items of plastic , golf balls and other rubbish strewn across guernsey 's coastline recently .
awareness of the problem has increased over the past six months , she says , possibly the result of an increased focus on the detrimental role of plastics in oceans around the world .
when you delve deeper to the implications of that rubbish that 's either on the beach or in the sea , you realise it 's not just unsightly it 's actually a fairly significant problem . ''
author: Isla Blatchford
BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: new edinburgh service eighth easyjet uk route
text: low-cost carrier easyjet is operating a new edinburgh route from jersey .
the summer season only service will compete with existing carrier flybe , which already flies to the scottish city .
from the end of march you will be able to fly direct to edinburgh twice-a-week , the eighth uk destination easyjet flies to from jersey .
jersey 's minister for economic development , tourism , sport and culture lyndon farnham said he was `` delighted '' the carrier was continuing to invest in the island .
`` the new link to edinburgh will provide further opportunities to grow our visitor economy as well as providing important links for islanders , '' he said .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: flooding expected on guernsey 's west coast again
text: a third day of flooding is expected to affect guernsey 's west coast this morning .
the met office has issued a flood warning for high tide at 08:45 .
low lying coastal areas are expected to be covered in water and drivers and pedestrians are being advised to take extreme care along coast roads .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: 'fewer than 10 beds free ' at jersey 's hospital
text: you 've been asked not to go to jersey 's hospital unless you are seriously ill as there is a shortage of beds .
the hospital has been placed on amber alert , meaning there are fewer than 10 beds free .
elsewhere , tens of thousands of non-urgent nhs operations and procedures in england may be deferred until 31 january , due to winter pressures .
in guernsey , hospital bed occupancy is at 88 % of capacity , and winter pressures are building , health bosses said .
jersey 's bed shortage is thought to be partly due to an increase in flu patients , mirroring a global rise seen in australia , new zealand and the uk .
the health department says it is keeping a close eye on the situation and has notified gps to try to keep referrals down .
officers say you should get advice from your doctor or pharmacist before going to a & e .
author: Naomi Dunning
BBC Radio Jersey, Reporter

documents.title: jersey sea wall breach 'could cost £ 20,000 '
text: it 's thought it 'll cost about £ 20,000 to fix the sea wall along victoria avenue .
a 65ft ( 20m ) section of the granite wall failed after it was hit by strong winds and waves earlier this week .
the area , which is roughly the length of a small swimming pool , is currently being protected by bags of sand and rubble , until the repair work can be done .
ten years ago the wall was reinforced with concrete and steel after a larger collapse during similar weather .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live for the channel islands
text: welcome tolocal live in the channel islands , we 'll be bringing you all the day 's news , sport , weather and travel and if you have a story email us .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online
